results.title: [Melbourne]
results.brief_description: An amateur film shot in Melbourne around 1935 which includes: footage of school children and gardeners in the Treasury and Fitzroy Gardens; a glimpse of traffic and a No. 13 tram in the city; construction work at the Shrine of Rememberance.

results.title: [Matthew Flinders: bi-centennial celebrations 1974]
results.creator_credit: Country Roads Board, Department of Agriculture and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Captures the various bi-centennial celebrations that were organised in Victoria to commemorate the birth of Captain Matthew Flinders. Includes footage of the Shrine; Mornington beach; Arthur’s Seat; Port Philip Bay; Station Peaks; Flinder’s Street Station; St Paul’s Cathedral; Swanston street; and the Matthew Flinders torch relay. Leading Victorian figures appear unveiling commemorative plaques. This is an un-edited film without a soundtrack which documents many of the celebrations.

results.title: RAAF Newsreel. No. 9. Operation sabre ferry
results.creator_credit: Harry Rayner and Australia. Royal Australian Air Force
results.brief_description: Newsreel items including: 1. No. 3 Squadron and No. 77 Squadron of the RAAF ferry the Sabre Jet from the east coast of Australia to Butterworth in Malaya via Townsville, Darwin, Netherlands New Guinea, Philippines, Borneo, Malaya. 2. Firefighter - RAAF demonstrates capability of new firefighting truck. 3. Addition of the new Air to Air Missile to the Sabre Jet Fighter. Test fired at Woomera.

results.title: [The Australian outback]
results.brief_description: On a cattle station 200 miles from Oodnadatta, stockmen are shown preparing for a muster, mustering scrub cattle, branding and droving the cattle to the trucking yards.

results.title: Drought feeding
results.brief_description: Discusses the various fuel values of different foodstuffs and gives much information on drought feeding of stock. Based on scientific investigations made by the Australian wool board into the subject of drought feeding of sheep, this film shows the fuel value of various types of supplementary fodder, taking into account both cost and nutritive value. The Wool Board makes available to pastoralists a Drought Feed Calculator, together with other tables relating to drought feeding, are clearly presented in this film.

results.title: Service to the inland (A)
results.creator_credit: J. Campbell Dobbie and Peerless Films
results.brief_description: A story of the inland telegraph, demonstrating the need for and efficiency of the inland communications system. Shows a message from a Northern Territory bush wireless to Dunlop Tyres translated into a narrative about developments in the outback (transportation, primary industry, the flying doctor etc.). Also includes footage of Aboriginal couriers travelling overland on foot, Aboriginal settlements, their culture, cooking, food gathering etc, in particular Emily’s Gap.

results.title: Tour of Tasmania, February 1950
results.brief_description: Home movie travelogue of Tasmania shot in February 1950. Includes scenes of several historic buildings and sites, and of Swansea, Port Arthur, Hobart and Cataract Gorge. No credits available.

results.title: The Sunny south-west
results.creator_credit: Australia. Dept. of Industry and Commerce
results.brief_description: Travelogue which covers a region of South-West Western Australia. Has scenes of Perth on the Swan River and street scenes including trams. War Memorial in Kings Park. Rottnest Island, Yanchup Park, Green Mt. National Park and the Darling Ranges. Bunbury Harbour and its surrounds. Sleeper cutting by hand for the railways from hardwood forests. Albany, originally the major seaport of W.A. Rugged coastal scenes of the region of Calgan River and The Sterling Ranges.
